[img]https://support.steampowered.com/steamvr/FitGuide/GuideHeader.png[/img]  	  	        	[h4]Minimum[/h4][list]  			[*]OS: Windows 10, SteamOS, Linux[/*]  			[*]Processor: Dual Core with Hyper-Threading[/*]	  			[*]Memory: 8 GB RAM[/*]	  			[*]Graphics: Nvidia GeForce GTX 970 / AMD RX 480[/*]	  			[*]Network: Broadband Internet connection[/*]	  			[*]Additional Notes: Available DisplayPort (Version1.2) and USB (2.0+) Port required  [/*]	  		[/list]    	[h4]Recommended[/h4][list]  			[*]Processor: Quad Core+[/*]  			[*]Graphics: Nvidia GeForce GTX 1070 or better[/*]	  			[*]Additional Notes: Available USB (3.0+) Port required for Headset Pass-Through Camera[/*]	  		[/list]	    	[h4]Tracking[/h4]The Index Headset requires a minimum of 1 (2 recommended) Base Stations for tracking. Index is compatible with both the original Vive Base Stations and the 2.0 versions available on the [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/1059570/Valve_Index_Base_Station/]Steam Store[/url].

[h4]Controllers[/h4]The Index Headset is compatible with Vive and Vive Pro Wands in addition to [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/1059550/Valve_Index_Controllers/]Valve's Index Controllers[/url].

[h4]Available Ports[/h4]The Index Headset requires that your system has the following ports available:

[list]  			[*]1 x DisplayPort 1.2+ for headset display[/*]  			[*]1 x USB 3.0+ for headset cameras[/*]  		[/list]        	[h4]Laptop Users[/h4]Laptops that use integrated graphics rather than a dedicated GPU that meets or exceeds our system requirements may not work with Index.

Please note: Index does not support HDMI, and will not work with DisplayPort to HDMI adapters.
title: VALVE Index System Requirements
